properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 14 at 6:21PM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
...EXTENDED PERIOD OF WINTER WEATHER CONTINUES...

.Snow showers will taper off this evening as they have become
more isolated. However, another round of heavy snow will develop
Wednesday afternoon through Thursday afternoon. The heaviest snow
will occur in the Mount Shasta area and Klamath Mountains, but the
Cascades and Siskiyous will also observe significant snow.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 2000 feet. Total snow
accumulations of 10 to 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50
mph over high exposed terrain.

* WHERE...Western Siskiyou County.

* WHEN...From 4 PM Wednesday to 4 PM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions.

* If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets,
food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is
likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective
action now.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM WEDNESDAY TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET
